meanings.sent1: The club had a nonofficial meeting to plan the event.
meanings.sent2: She wore a nonofficial badge to the party.
meanings.sent3: The nonofficial team captain forgot the game plan.
meanings.sent4: His nonofficial status as leader made him a rebel in the group.
meanings.sent5: The nonofficial document was quickly dismissed by the authorities.

meanings.definition: Not holding an official position or title.
meanings.sent1: The nonofficial members of the committee had valuable insights.
meanings.sent2: He was a nonofficial advisor to the mayor.
meanings.sent3: The nonofficial spokesperson made everyone laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her nonofficial role as mediator brought peace to the dispute.
meanings.sent5: The nonofficial volunteer worked tirelessly to help the community.
